lines.gurmukhi: cMdn smIp bis bwNs mihmwN n jwnI; Awn dRum dUr Bey bwsnw kY bohy hY [

Shamsher Singh Puri.translation: Just as a bamboo has not known the merits of a sandalwood tree having lived near it, but other trees though far away from it still acquire its fragrance.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: ijvyˆ cMdn dy nyVy bwˆs ny v`skyaus dI mihmw nhIˆ jwxI, hor ibRC jo dUr sn auh aus dI vSnw nwl sugMiDq ho gey[

lines.gurmukhi: dwdr srovr mYN jwnY n kml giq; mkrMd kir mDkr hI ibmohy hY [

Shamsher Singh Puri.translation: A frog knows not the goodness of a lotus flower though it stays in the same pond, but bumble bees are crazy of the nectar that is stored in these flowers.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: f`fU srovr ivc v`sidAwˆ kml dI KUbI nhIˆ jwxdw, kml ivc v`s rhy mkrMd rs kr ky qwˆ BOry hI moihq huMdy hn[

lines.gurmukhi: sursrI ibKY bg jwnÎo n mrm kCU; Awvq hY jwqRI jMqR jwqRw hyq sohy hY [

Shamsher Singh Puri.translation: An egret living in the waters of river Ganges does not know the importance of that water, but many people come to the river Ganges on a pilgrimage and feel honoured.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: gMgw ivc v`s ky bgly ny gMgw dw kuC Byd nhIˆ jwixAw, pr mihmw jwxn vwly XwqRI Xwqrw krn vwsqy XwqRIAwˆ dy inXm Anuswr Awauˆdy hn, qy sohxy ho jwˆdy hn[

lines.gurmukhi: inkt bsq mm gur aupdys hIn; dUr hI idsMqr aur AMqr lY pohy hY [639[

Shamsher Singh Puri.translation: Similarly, though I live near the True Guru, I am bereft of the knowledge of His advice whereas people from far off places come to the True Guru, obtain His sermon and abides it in their heart. (639)

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: iqvyˆ mYˆ gurU dy nyVy v`sidAwˆ BI gurU aupdyS qoˆ hIxw hwˆ[ prdUr dUr qy dyswˆqRwˆ ivc rihx vwly SrDw vwly isK gur aupdyS lY ky ihrdy ivc pRo lYˆdy hn ]639]
